availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elisha Green (Union County, Tennessee, farmer and soldier (U.S.A.))

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Robert Green and Ann Green. Married to Mary Green. Father of Sarah A. Green and Roda J. Green. Farmer in Lee County, Virginia in 1850. Farmer in Union County, Tennessee in 1860. Served in the 11th Regiment Tennessee Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as sergeant. Died in service on April 8, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Lee County, District 31, p. 397A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, District 9, p. 477.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Tennessee, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M395, Roll 0092.
Find A Grave, "Elisha Green (unknown-April 8, 1864)," Memorial #10353376, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10353376 (accessed January 30, 2020).
